txt.en: 'In exchange, they have prepared these gifts.'
'Warlord Dushtalbúk. What brings the Frost-bound to our peaks?'
'We are in your debt, Warlord.'
'We accept your gifts, Angmarim, but I remain unconvinced.'
'They have taught my sisters and I the power to control the dead, to summon spirits from beyond and bind them to our will.'
'Hmph. Indeed you are.'
'These Men are Angmarim. They seek passage through your lands, and permission to perform... 'rituals' in the high peaks.'
'Our mother does not trust the former servants of Sauron.'
'They wish to swear themselves to the Frost-horde, now that their Nazgûl master is gone.'
'And we also owe you our thanks, Lady Loknashra.'
'Hah! They will make excellent nest guardians.'
Talk to Molkha
'I can speak to their usefulness, O frigid ones.'
'I greet you, children of the Frost-heart.'
Listen to the conversation
'So be it, Frost-bound. You will not be devoured this day, Angmarim!'
'Come, tell me of your plans in the Welkin-lofts. And tell me more of this... Drugoth.'
Molkha has a troubling report to share: the Frost-bound Hobgoblins, the Angmarim, and the Drakes of the Frost-horde are negotiating alliances and using fallen dwarves as bargaining chips.
'There they are. Kneel, and let me do the talking, Angmarim.'
Molkha is describing what she saw transpire between the drakes, hobgoblins, and Angmarim.\n\nYou should listen to the conversation.
'Then I heard a terrible roar, and made sure I was out of sight!'
'Why are these MEN with you?'
Molkha is ready to describe what she saw earlier.\n\nYou should talk to Molkha.

'Using the re-animated bodies of fallen dwarves as mere tokens of favour? Despicable... the hobgoblins and Angmarim then left, heading South. I did not come out of hiding for a long while, for fear of the drakes seeing me from above!'
'We will be watching! Prove yourselves to our mother!'
Instance: A Troubling Report
'Not long ago, I witnessed the hobgoblins and Angmarim passing through. When they reached this frozen lake, they stopped and looked toward the sky....'
